items.sentence: This room is very small, so it is impossible to put more furniture in it.
Tom says that he almost never has more than three hundred dollars on him.
In all my travels I've never seen a more beautiful mountain than Everest.
Some students in this university don't even know how to talk to teachers.
The world as we know it is probably going to end within the next century.
We waited for Tom at the library for half an hour, but he didn't turn up.
There's an interesting article in this magazine about education problems.
Yelling about it won't help now. You should've done that when it counted.
Strictly speaking, she didn't like it at all, but she didn't say a thing.
At first, Tom seemed angry, but then I realized that he was just worried.
I know that eventually I'm going to have to tell Tom about what happened.
Man, I just saw it on the news! Damn, you're making me doubt my own eyes!
Comedy always includes a little tragedy. That's why there are sad clowns.
I wouldn't have bought this if I'd known it had been made by slave labor.
If you don't do what the boss told you to do, you're likely to get fired.
If Tom had been wearing a helmet, he wouldn't have been so badly injured.
Just because you like something doesn't mean everyone else likes it, too.
I don't want to spend more than thirty dollars on Tom's birthday present.
I understand everything now and I regret that Tom isn't here with me now.
Tom was afraid Mary might poke her eye out, so he told her to be careful.
